quoteLast: --a column of water leapt vertically upwards at less than four hundred yards from the shore.  There was a shrieking sound like the screech of a high velocity projectile, followed by a detonation so powerful that most of the spectators on the sea-front were deaf for days afterwards.
title: The Rival Submarines
author: Westerman, Percy F. (Percy Francis), 1876-1959; Williams, C. Fleming [Illustrator]

title:
The Romance of Modern Invention
Containing Interesting Descriptions in Non-technical Language of Wireless Telegraphy, Liquid Air, Modern Artillery, Submarines, Dirigible Torpedoes, Solar Motors, Airships, &c. &c.
author: Williams, Archibald, 1871-1934

quoteLast: a Gomez-Dep roadster appeared down the road, stopped at the garage. To Milt it was as exciting as the appearance of a comet to a watching astronomer.
title: Free Air
author: Lewis, Sinclair, 1885-1951
